channel.title: If Only You Set Me Free on
channel.description: Recent content in If Only You Set Me Free on

item.title: Alucinara Energy
item.description: Overview Alucinara, alucinara energy, or magic, is an immanent form of energy which alters the laws of nature in anomalous ways by allowing the ‘dreamscape’ to affect reality.

item.title: Aqhor
item.description: Overview

item.title: Asaran
item.description: Overview Asaran trees are a species of evergreen conifer trees native to the mediterranean regions of the 2nd realm. They bear small, berry-like cones, which are used in cooking, and light wood which is used to make tools.

item.title: Bushdeer
item.description: Overview Bushdeer are a genus of deer native to the 2nd and -1st realms. They are herbivores descended from Sika deer, but feature kleptoplastic shrubbery on their antlers and skeleton-like fur patterns.

item.title: Canara
item.description: Overview Canara is a type of nut, the fruit of the Canara tree. Canara trees are native to the continental forests and mediterranean regions of the 2nd realm, being a mainstay of Morellic cooking.

item.title: Cloud Gnats
item.description: Overview Cloud Gnats are animal-like apparitions made of aluciferous dust. They commonly appear as small animals, standing upright with their abdomen tapering off into a wispy tail.

item.title: Coroth
item.description: Overview Coroth was a Morellic city state and civilisation founded in the Neolithic Era. The land of Coroth was situated in the continental forests of southern Tseireph, to the east of Sarvara.

item.title: Creepvine
item.description: Overview Creepvine is a species of plant native to the forests of the -1st and -3rd realms. It commonly grows upon other plants, such as ribwood, acting as a parasitic weed.

item.title: Darkness
item.description: Overview Darkness is an extraneous form of energy which forms the foundation of the soul alongside alucinara energy. Darkness is contained within organic compounds (hydrocarbons, tar, amino acids, etc.

item.title: Dhajar
item.description: Overview Dhajar trees are a species of coniferous tree native to the continental forests of the 2nd realm. Their wood is a common material in carpentry, especially in Coroth and the Empire of the Petrified Child.

item.title: Dragons
item.description: Overview Dragons are a genus of amphibians native to the -1st, -3rd, and all ultra-essent realms, including the 2nd. They are omnivorous, flight-capable through the use of alucinara, and semi-aquatic, inhabiting wetlands, rivers, swamps, lakes, and oases.

item.title: Elkwort
item.description: Overview Elkwort is a herb native to the continental regions of the 2nd and -1st realms, related to ferns. It is a common garden plant, used in Corothic and Stonechild Imperial cooking.

item.title: Every Force of Nature
item.description: *So, every force of nature showed the shattered ways the crystal glowed. A gemstone fit to lose our minds, that let us know such things remote; the broken ways the aura binds

item.title: Flying Squirrels
item.description: Overview

item.title: Giant Snails
item.description: Overview

item.title: Glara
item.description: Overview Glara are a species of tree native to the tropical rainforests of the 2nd and -2nd realms. They bear luminescent fruit, common in Nethic food.

item.title: Great Bees
item.description: Overview

item.title: High Matriarch of Sarvara
item.description: Overview The term ‘High Matriarch’ (sometimes ‘High Patriarch’) is the name given to the rulers of Sarvara and some other nations, especially the Empire of the Petrified Child and within the wider Morellic sphere of influence.

item.title: Kerelh
item.description: Overview Kherell is the 3rd planet of the Caura system, situated within the sun’s habitable zone. It has two moons, the larger Ena and smaller Udru.

item.title: Lunaflower
item.description: Overview Lunaflower is a plant native to the 2nd and -3rd realms.

item.title: Lunuth
item.description: Overview Lunuth wheat is a type of domesticated cereal grain native to the 2nd realm. It is a staple crop for many cultures, especially of Sarvara, by whom it was domesticated.

item.title: Minikin
item.description: Overview Minikin (spp. Anthrosciurus sapiens) are a species of small rodents native to the 2nd realm. They are anthropoid, arboreal omnivores descended from the European Red Squirrel.

item.title: Nyuta
item.description: Overview Nyuta is a type of berry, the fruit of the Nyuta bush. Nyuta bushes are native to the plains of the 2nd and 1st realms, and their leaves form the main ingredient in Nyuta tea; they are scarcely found aside from orchards, and are a high-class symbol.

item.title: Pelen
item.description: Overview Pelen is a type of root vegetable, similar to carrots, native to the plains regions of the 2nd and 3rd realms.

item.title: Phantasmarrhoea
item.description: Overview Phantasmarrhoea (Sarvaran: Fantasmeyolh ) is a physiological condition that affects living beings. It causes those affected, known as Phantasms, to experience irreversable physical and mental effects, leading to the growth of Alucinarium on the body and psychosis.

item.title: Ribwood
item.description: Overview Ribwood trees are a species of tree native to the forests and jungles of the -3rd realm. Appearance Ribwood trees are long and winding, with eponymous ribbed bark that repeats in rings along the trunk.

item.title: Sarkitwara
item.description: Overview Sarkitwara is a type of citron fruit, the fruit of the Sarkitwara tree. Sarkitwara trees are native to the mediterranean and hot wilderness regions of the 2nd and 1st realms, and are a common food item for their cohabitant fauna.

item.title: Sarvara
item.description: Overview Sarvara (Sarvaran: ‘Sarvárą’ IPA: /sar.vá.rã/) was a Morellic city state and a civilisation whose society, territory, and culture extended beyond its original city walls.

item.title: Sarvaran Architecture
item.description: Overview The architecture of Sarvara refers to the many styles and methods of building structures within the city state, and further settlements and outposts within its cultural sphere.

item.title: Sarvaran Calendar
item.description: Overview The Sarvaran calendar was the official calendar of the Sarvaran empire, and was used in most parts of the Sarvaran river basin during the empire’s tenure in the Bronze age.

item.title: Sarvaran History
item.description: Overview Ancient Sarvara was a civilisation founded by the early Morellic tribes in southern Tseireph. The civilisation began in the eponymous city-state of Sarvara, which would go on to flourish into one of the first, and most influencial, empires of the 2nd realm.

item.title: Sarvaran Instruments
item.description: Overview Sarvaran culture was rich with artwork and innovation. The four most prominent fields in ancient Sarvara were pottery, poetry, architecture, and music.

item.title: Sharadism
item.description: Overview Sharadism is a physiological condition that affects organic beings. It causes those affected, known as Sharadith1, to undergo many irreversable physical, mental, and spiritual changes, resulting in a grotesque appearance and insatiable need to consume the blood and flesh of others.

item.title: Slugfolk
item.description: Overview Slugfolk are a species of hermaphroditic gastropod mollusks native to the 1st realm. They are terrestrial, semi-anthropoid herbivores descended from the Great Grey Slug.

item.title: Snoutgoats
item.description: Overview Snoutgoats are a species of small, semi-arboreal goats native to the 1st and 2nd realms, inhabiting the steppes and mountainous areas.

item.title: Sorcerism
item.description: Overview Sorcerism is a condition that grants those affected with the ability to manipulate the laws of nature through the use of Alucinara.

item.title: Soulstones
item.description: Overview Soulstones are deposits of bitumen or asphalt where, in the presence of alucinara energy, the soul of a deceased organism may be stored after death.

item.title: Sweetrice
item.description: Overview Sweetrice is a type of domesticated cereal grain native to the southwestern continent of the 2nd realm. It is a staple crop for the minikin of Aqhor, who brought it to the Sarvaran river basin from their homeland.

item.title: The 2nd Realm
item.description: Overview The 2nd realm is the 2nd ultra-essent realm, and is contra-essent to the -2nd realm. The 2nd realm’s main planet is Kherell, inhabited by the native minikin.

item.title: The Angels
item.description: Overview The Angels are celestial beings created by the Judges to govern the different elements of the original creation, which reside in the dreamscape.

item.title: The Early Morellic Tribes
item.description: Overview The early Morellic tribes were made up of nomadic, matrilineal clans living in the south of Tseireph during the minikin Mesolithic era, or Middle Stone Age.

item.title: The Judges
item.description: Overview The Judges were the two uncreated celestial beings who created the universe. They made the original creation, alucinara energy, the angels, life, and ultimately darkness.

item.title: The Language of Sarvara
item.description: Overview Sarvaran was a Morellic language spoken in the Sarvaran civilisation during the Minikin bronze-age. It was polysynthetic, head-final, and head-marking, with an SOV word order.

item.title: The Mind Controls
item.description: *A rodent sat atop the cliff of an inlet, its whole life built upon service to an instinct. Staring down at the rocks upon which a wave rolls, here the world now makes sense, to the heart, so thoughts sink’d;

item.title: The Petrified Child
item.description: Overview The Petrified Child is a semi-corporeal deity which is worshipped in many monotheistic and polytheistic religions, and can reside within both the corporeal realms and the dreamscape.

item.title: The Realms
item.description: Overview The realms are the planes of existence within which one can exist and manipulate matter, energy, and information. There are 8 realms; the 7 corporeal realms, and the Dreamscape.

item.title: The Sharadith
item.description: Chapter One (In the 33rd year of the reign of High Matriarch Ramsen of the Empire of the Petrified Child)

item.title: The Sun Grows Dark
item.description: Sarvaran Text *Eyúdhran ikűmma lisi̋nnanis cádra kelh ankéiranith liką́rh musápra. Ámerith íkų̈ lówerith ánïtirh éyïrath, kelh eyán ástïrilh lísï eyápąrath.*

item.title: Thnayya
item.description: Overview Thnayya was a prehistoric civilisation of minikin in the 2nd realm. It was located in south Tseireph, in a time when the sea levels were lower, and is now located in the Aqhoran strait off the coast of the Sarvaran river basin.

item.title: Treemice
item.description: Overview Treemice are a species of small arboreal primates native to the 1st and 2nd realms. They are nocturnal omnivores descended from Slow Lorises, consuming tree gum, fruit, leaves, slugs, and mainly insects.

item.title: Tseireph
item.description: Overview Tseireph is a continent of the planet Kherell in the 2nd realm. It is notable for being the source of the Morellic Minikin, and the place where civilisation emerged1.

item.title: Wallabies
item.description: Overview Wallabies are a species of marsupials native to the 1st and 2nd realms. They are diurnal herbivores descended from the Dwarf Wallabies of the 0th realm, consuming wild grasses, leaves, and vegetables.

item.title: Watchstones
item.description: Overview Watchstones are stones1 with eyes through which the Petrified Child sees, giving the deity a greater visual field and protecting those nearby from evil.

item.title: Weasels
item.description: Overview Weasels are a group of carnivorous predatory mustelids native to the 0th, 2nd, and -1st realms. The term includes common weasels, stoats, ferrets, mink, and archweasels.

item.title: Widrens
item.description: Overview Widrens, also known as Black Owls, are a group of nocturnal, predatory birds native to the -1st and -3rd realms.

item.title: Wildcats
item.description: Overview Wildcats are a genus of predatory felines native to the -1st and 2nd realms. They are carnivores descended from the European Wildcat.

item.title: Wolfrats
item.description: Overview Wolfrats are a species of carnivorous rodents native to the -1st and -3rd realms. They are predators descended from Grasshopper Mice, but are larger and bulkier.

item.title: Woolly Hogs
item.description: Overview Woolly Hogs are a species of small, woolly suids native to the 2nd realm. They are omnivores descended from the Eurasian Wild Boar.
